remarks: Lines are subset of the geometry base set.  That is, lines are sets of points.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 17-May-2019.)
statement:
tglngval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglngval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglngval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglngval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglngval.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
tglngval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
tglngval.z $e |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
tglnssp $p |- ( ph -> ( X L Y ) C_ P ) $.
